name: ANCDT07
title: ANC.DT.07 Ultrasound recommendation
description: An ultrasound is recommended for all pregnant women before 24 weeks of gestation (early ultrasound). If there's no ultrasound available at that health-carte facility, the woman should be referred to another facility in which she can receive an ultrasound.

coding.display: woman’s history/profile or lab and imaging tests

action.textEquivalent: An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation

documentation.label: WHO ANC recommendations (2016): B.2.4. Ultrasound scan (3)

action.title: Conduct ultrasound at the health-care facility or the referral facility optional if deemed necessary by the health worker
action.textEquivalent: An ultrasound is recommended for all women even after 24 weeks gestation if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation or placenta location)

documentation.label: WHO ANC recommendations (2016): B.2.4. Ultrasound scan (3)

action.title: Conduct ultrasound scan
action.description: "Referral for screening including diagnostics and lab testing" = FALSE
action.textEquivalent:
An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation or even after if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation or placenta location). 
An early ultrasound is key to estimate gestational age, improve detection of fetal anomalies and multiple fetuses, reduce induction of labour for post-term pregnancy, and improve a woman’s pregnancy experience.

documentation.label: WHO ANC recommendations (2016): B.2.4. Ultrasound scan (3)

expression.description:
("Ultrasound scan conducted" = FALSE)
  AND ("Ultrasound available at the health-care facility" = TRUE)
  AND ("Gestational age" < 24 weeks)
expression.expression: Should \"Referral for screening including diagnostics and lab testing\" = FALSE

action.title: Refer to a facility with ultrasound equipment
action.description: "Referral for screening including diagnostics and lab testing" = TRUE
action.textEquivalent:
If an ultrasound cannot be conducted at the health-care facility, the woman should be referred to another health-care facility in which she can receive an ultrasound. 
An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation or even after if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation or placenta location). 
An early U/S is key to estimate gestational age, improve detection of fetal anomalies and multiple fetuses, reduce induction of labour for post-term pregnancy, and improve a woman’s pregnancy experience.
